summary: This is an email chain from July 24-25, 2019, discussing a report from the Bureau of Prisons that Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a noose around his neck. The email expresses shock that he was taken off suicide watch and notes his cellmate reported being threatened.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck; initially placed on suicide watch then downgraded to suicide observation.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.context: AW at MCC New York advised about Epstein's condition and the threat reported by his cellmate.

persons.name: Supervisory Deputy United States Marshal
persons.context: Sent the report about Epstein's incident to the email recipients.

connections.description: The Associate Warden at MCC New York reported on Epstein's condition and status in custody.
The Marshal relayed the Bureau of Prisons report regarding Epstein's incident.

events.title: Epstein found with noose in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck, escorted to medical, and initially placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Cellmate reports threat
events.description: Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened by Epstein.

events.title: Email discussion of Epstein incident
events.description: Email chain discusses the report of Epstein's condition, expressing shock that he was taken off suicide watch.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York on July 24, 2019, at 0127 hours with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was initially placed on suicide watch but was subsequently downgraded to suicide observation.
Epstein's cellmate reported being threatened by Epstein.
The incident is under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons.
The email expresses shock that Epstein was taken off suicide watch.
